docs.lead_paragraph: Wrapup: Maybe we were expecting too much -- an intergalactic showdown. Instead, it was more of a chess game, with each side moving forward and occasionally knocking off the other's pieces. Instead of ending in checkmate, they ended with a hands-across-the-water moment.

docs.lead_paragraph: The New York State Catholic Conference has produced a blistering nine-minute YouTube video that assails a proposal by the Spitzer administration to update abortion laws. The creation of the video, which argues that the State Senate offers the best hope of defeating the measure, suggests that abortion could emerge as a hot issue in the state elections this fall. Republicans will try to hold on to their thin margin in the Senate, their last bastion of power in Albany, but strong turnout for the presidential election could aid Democratic efforts to take control of the entire Legislature for the first time in decades.

headline.main: Video Intensifies Abortion Debate in Albany

docs.lead_paragraph: Lane Kenworthy asks whether the United States has the highest poverty rate when you calculate it in absolute rather than relative terms -- that is, by asking whether families are above the US poverty line rather than above half of median income.
docs.abstract: Lane Kenworthy asks whether the United States has the highest poverty rate when you calculate it in absolute rather than relative terms - that is, by asking whether families are above the US poverty line rather than above half of median income. The answer is, yes, probably - at best we're number 2 among rich [...]
